meanings.sent1: I need to decouple the old printer from the computer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to decouple the power source before making any changes.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decouple the tangled earphones was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to effortlessly decouple the rings in his mesmerizing act.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to decouple from the spaceship to float freely in space.

meanings.definition: To break the connection between two things
meanings.sent1: The storm caused the tree branches to decouple from the power lines.
meanings.sent2: Please decouple the cables carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to decouple the bird feeder from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to resign would decouple her from the stressful work environment.
meanings.sent5: The key was used to decouple the lock from the door.

meanings.definition: To remove the link or relationship between two things
meanings.sent1: The therapist helped them decouple their emotions from past experiences.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to decouple personal feelings from professional decisions.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to decouple the spicy sauce from the mild dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's intention was to decouple the painting from its traditional style.
meanings.sent5: The new policy aimed to decouple financial success from employee satisfaction.
